# Stickleback Dry Fish Food Mix {#sec-husbandry-dry_fish_food}

## Introduction

-   **Purpose**: This procedure describes standard practices for mixing of dry food to feed all life stages of threespine stickleback in the Pacific Stickleback Facility.
-   **Procedure Type**: Husbandry
-   **Species**:
    -   Threespine stickleback, (*Gasterosteus aculeatus*)
-   **Author**: Mark Currey
-   **Date Created**: August 25, 2014; updated January 26, 2023 by Mark Currey
-   **IACUC Protocol**: Covered under facility maintenance procedures

::: {.callout-warning title="Notes"}
At each new mixing of dry food (approximately once per week) food containers will be cleaned (washed in the dishwasher) and spoons cleaned with 70% ETOH. The beaker that holds feeding spoons will also be replaced with clean beaker.
:::

::: {.callout-note title="Note"}
If we are out of one of the types of food it is ok to omit it from the mix. Continue with available ingredients.
:::

## Materials

-   Plastic measuring cup
-   Clean food container with lid
-   Clean spoons for feeding
-   Beaker for storing spoons
-   70% Ethanol for cleaning

## Solutions

-   None required

## Procedure

### Food Mix Recipes

Mix equal parts of the following ingredients. Store at 4°C in fish facility food fridge. Label with an expiration date of 1 month from mixing.

1.  **Fry Mix**:
    -   100-200 micron golden pearls
    -   Ziegler AP100

2.  **Juvenile Mix** (label with a yellow dot or yellow tape):
    -   Aquanix cool mix flakes (or other flake food)
    -   200-300 micron golden pearls
    -   Otohime C1 pellets

3.  **Adult Mix**:
    -   Otohime S1
    -   Ziegler zebrafish diet
    -   Hikari micro pellet
    -   Golden pearls 500-800 micron
    -   Aquanix cool mix flakes (or other flake food)

### Preparation Steps

1.  **Clean containers**: Wash food containers in dishwasher. See @sec-husbandry-dishwasher for dishwasher use.

2.  **Clean spoons**: Clean feeding spoons with 70% ETOH.

3.  **Clean beaker**: Replace beaker that holds feeding spoons with clean beaker.

4.  **Measure and mix**: Using measuring cup, measure equal parts of each ingredient and mix thoroughly in clean container.

5.  **Label**: Label container with:
    -   Mix type (Fry, Juvenile, or Adult)
    -   Date mixed
    -   Expiration date (1 month from mixing date)
    -   Color code for juvenile mix (yellow dot or tape)

6.  **Store**: Store at 4°C in fish facility food fridge.
